\u2022 CPR instructions are shown in 6 steps - every step is scrollable with finger
\u2022 User swipes with finger over the screen to open next or previous step - swiping to right opens previous step if available, swiping to the left opens next step
\u2022 After all steps are finished user can go back to step 4 or step 5 by clicking a button or swiping to the left to show step 4
\u2022 To exit the CPR steps user has to long press on the screen until quit option appears. If user presses the X icon that will take him to the main menu.
\u2022 To exit the application - while not glancing through CPR steps - swipe to the right until you are out.
1. Check the scene - Make sure the scene is safe
2. Check the person - Tap the person on the shoulder and shout: Are you OK?
3. Ask a bystander to call Emergency services
1. Open the airway - With the person lying on his or her back, tilt the head back slightly to lift the chin.
1. Check for breathing - Listen carefully for sounds of breathing(10 seconds max)
2. If there is no breathing continue with CPR.
1. Rescue Breath 1x - Pinch the nose shut. Forming a tight seal, place your mouth over the person’s open mouth
2. See if the chest rises. If it doesn’t, do head tilt and chin lift again. Give the 2nd full breath for 1 second
1. Chest Compressions: Kneel at the person’s side near the chest. Place one hand 2 cm above the V where the ribs join the breastbone. Place the other hand on top of the one already in place

2. Lean over the person and press straight down on the chest using only the palms of your hands. Keep your arms straight. Depress the middle of the chest between the nipples about 4-5 cm. Give about 100 compressions a minute. Relax pressure completely after each compression.
1. Give cycles of 30 chest compressions and 2 rescue breaths - without a break
2. Give CPR until: The person moves or medical help takes over
Repeat cycles of 30 chest compressions and 2 rescue breaths - without a break
